intro: Delissea gayana var. wainihaensis, commonly known as the Wainihaensis delissea, is a rare and unique plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
